thread.title: Women still face uphill battle for breast cancer tests, despite new density notifications
thread.title_full: Women still face uphill battle for breast cancer tests, despite new density notifications

author: LISA FLETCHER, ANDREA NEJMAN, NATHAN AARON AND MIKE GRIFFITH | Spotlight on America
title: Women still face uphill battle for breast cancer tests, despite new density notifications
text: {p}Women across America are getting potentially life-saving information in their mammogram reports. A sweeping federal mandate now requires them to be told whether they have dense breast tissue, which can increase their risk of cancer. But it is what happens next that matters most, and why one member of Congress is leading the fight to make sure all women get the critical cancer screening they need.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"STANDALONE-%20Breast%20Tissue%20Density\" data-caption=\"STANDALONE-%20Breast%20Tissue%20Density\" data-duration=\"217.151453 \" data-externalid=\"e54d2d40-25bc-4398-8a7f-09527e7b8b75\" data-mediatype=\"video\" data-renditions=\"\" data-url=\"https://harvest-media-clips.sinclairstoryline.com/UPLOAD/e54d2d40-25bc-4398-8a7f-09527e7b8b75/HLS/index.m3u8\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-media-no-thumb%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Ciframe%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20width=%22560%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20height=%22315%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20class=%22sda-embeded-player-iframe%20sda-VideoEmbed-iframe%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20src=%22/resources/embeds/vod.html?externalId=e54d2d40-25bc-4398-8a7f-09527e7b8b75&thumbUrl=https%253A%252F%252Fharvest-media-clips.sinclairstoryline.com%252FUPLOAD%252Fe54d2d40-25bc-4398-8a7f-09527e7b8b75%252Fthumbnails%252F 5.jpg%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20frameborder=%22no%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/iframe%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-caption-no-thumb%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cspan%3ECaption:%20STANDALONE-%20Breast%20Tissue%20Density%3C/span%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}More than 40-percent of women have dense breast tissue, putting them at an increased risk of cancer.{/p}{p}Dense tissue can mask tumors on a mammogram because dense tissue and tumors are both white.{/p}{p}It has delayed critical diagnoses in women across America, as our years of {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/spotlight-on-america/fda-requires-all-women-to-be-informed-about-breast-density-a-known-cancer-risk-factor-health-diagnosis-mammograms-annual-screenings-ultrasound-mri-fda-requirement-tumors-cancer-double-mastectomy\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/spotlight-on-america/fda-requires-all-women-to-be-informed-about-breast-density-a-known-cancer-risk-factor-health-diagnosis-mammograms-annual-screenings-ultrasound-mri-fda-requirement-tumors-cancer-double-mastectomy\"}reporting {/a}have revealed.{/p}{p}Density is a known risk factor, but little is known about why.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"breast1.PNG\" data-caption=\"Dense%20breast%20tissue%20and%20breast%20cancer%20both%20show%20up%20white%20on%20mammograms,%20often%20making%20ultrasounds%20and%20MRI's%20better%20tools%20to%20identify%20cancer%20in%20a%20dense%20breast,%20Photo:%20SBG\" 648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/671/648/0x38/90/6a9f29e9-84b2-4dd3-9f1f-42ade535cd31-breast1.PNG%22,%22width%22:671,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:38,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%222aa5facd-9daf-4bd7-8d40-60f94bf71497%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media2/16x9/671/648/0x38/90/6a9f29e9-84b2-4dd3-9f1f-42ade535cd31-breast1.PNG\" data-title=\"breast1.PNG\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media2/16x9/671/648/0x38/90/6a9f29e9-84b2-4dd3-9f1f-42ade535cd31-breast1.PNG%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3EDense%20breast%20tissue%20and%20breast%20cancer%20both%20show%20up%20white%20on%20mammograms,%20often%20making%20ultrasounds%20and%20MRI's%20better%20tools%20to%20identify%20cancer%20in%20a%20dense%20breast,%20Photo:%20SBG%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}“We’ve been working on dense breast cancer for about three to four years now,” said Dr. Noelle Cutter, Associate Professor of Biology and Chemistry at Molloy University.{/p}{p}Cutter is an Iron-Man triathlete, in a class of women by all accounts in their prime: fit, healthy and young and who should not be facing cancer. Yet little by little, these diagnoses were permeating her friend group.{/p}{p}“That’s actually what started my questioning of this, is why so many of these women were getting diagnosed with breast cancer and really having to be put under these hugely impactful chemotherapy radiation protocols,” said Cutter. “I think that that's been a huge passion of mine. Just answering that question.”{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"drcutter2.PNG\" data-caption=\"An%20elite%20athlete,%20Dr.%20Noelle%20Cutter%20has%20been%20striving%20to%20understand%20why%20breast%20cancer%20can%20impact%20young,%20healthy%20women%20(Photo:%20Noelle%20Cutter)%7Bp%7D%7B/p%7D\" data-duration=\"\" data-externalid=\"443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634\" data-mediatype=\"image\" data-renditions=\"%7B%22large16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:615,%22label%22:%22large16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:986,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/986/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22,%22width%22:1093,%22x%22:9,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22a0ca8991-7613-4aa2-b37a-4159474eeeec%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22large16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22large16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22large16x9%22%7D,%22jumbo16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:615,%22label%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1320,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/1320/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22,%22width%22:1093,%22x%22:9,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%222fb5ea44-4a11-4930-a6a2-cea6af0d721c%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22jumbo16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22jumbo16x9%22%7D,%22small16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:615,%22label%22:%22small16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:160,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/160/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22,%22width%22:1093,%22x%22:9,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%228f1a4802-c65d-4f34-bc99-3018bf535cbe%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22small16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22small16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22small16x9%22%7D,%22full16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:615,%22label%22:%22full16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1093,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/1111/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22,%22width%22:1093,%22x%22:9,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22306c95f7-71c5-45da-83d4-5f1f52c194ae%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22full16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22full16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22full16x9%22%7D,%22medium16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:615,%22label%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/648/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22,%22width%22:1093,%22x%22:9,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%2250d7db33-d321-4964-8d30-7da669ce62c3%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media2/16x9/1093/648/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG\" data-title=\"Women%20still%20face%20uphill%20battle%20for%20breast%20cancer%20tests,%20despite%20new%20density%20notifications\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media2/16x9/1093/648/9x0/90/443ce1da-1aa5-4223-9d7e-0af5d6463634-drcutter2.PNG%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3EAn%20elite%20athlete,%20Dr.%20Noelle%20Cutter%20has%20been%20striving%20to%20understand%20why%20breast%20cancer%20can%20impact%20young,%20healthy%20women%20(Photo:%20Noelle%20Cutter)%3Cp%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}It’s a question that launched her groundbreaking new research that could change the way women with dense breast cancer are diagnosed and treated.{/p}{p}Cutter’s lab found that cancer cells in dense breast tissue may actually be resistant to chemotherapy.{/p}{p}“When we repeat-treat them with chemotherapy, they're not dying,” said Cutter. “So, they're not responding to the treatment as we might expect. They're surviving, and then the populations of cells that do survive are inherently more resistant to the treatment.”{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"drcutter1.PNG\" data-caption=\"Dr.%20Noelle%20Cutter%20found%20that%20cancer%20cells%20in%20dense%20breast%20tissue%20may%20be%20more%20resistant%20to%20treatment%20(Photo:%20Noelle%20Cutter)\" data-duration=\"\" data-externalid=\"e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2\" data-mediatype=\"image\" data-renditions=\"%7B%22large16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:597,%22label%22:%22large16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:986,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/986/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22,%22width%22:1061,%22x%22:48,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%225ed47be3-1309-4f8e-bf66-e8785d3c4be9%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22large16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22large16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22large16x9%22%7D,%22jumbo16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:597,%22label%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1320,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/1320/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22,%22width%22:1061,%22x%22:48,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%2227a96830-56d7-406e-8e8a-640faaf21b09%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22jumbo16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22jumbo16x9%22%7D,%22small16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:597,%22label%22:%22small16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:160,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/160/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22,%22width%22:1061,%22x%22:48,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22a619cd8f-7010-4027-9254-edbc505c34b5%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22small16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22small16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22small16x9%22%7D,%22full16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:597,%22label%22:%22full16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1061,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/1157/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22,%22width%22:1061,%22x%22:48,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%2244698276-c9bb-4b93-a72f-eb98929b22a0%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22full16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22full16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22full16x9%22%7D,%22medium16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:597,%22label%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/648/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22,%22width%22:1061,%22x%22:48,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22db0b29fd-a604-4bb0-9fbc-1818785ca450%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media2/16x9/1061/648/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG\" data-title=\"Women%20still%20face%20uphill%20battle%20for%20breast%20cancer%20tests,%20despite%20new%20density%20notifications\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media2/16x9/1061/648/48x0/90/e8048a45-19d6-4ca5-9b36-a3f9ea4e8ce2-drcutter1.PNG%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3EDr.%20Noelle%20Cutter%20found%20that%20cancer%20cells%20in%20dense%20breast%20tissue%20may%20be%20more%20resistant%20to%20treatment%20(Photo:%20Noelle%20Cutter)%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Dr. Cutter’s research is expected to be published in a major medical journal this year and it could provide essential information about the unique risks and treatments for patients with dense breasts.{/p}{p}The key, says Cutter, is catching dense breast cancer early with tools like MRI and ultrasound.{/p}{blockquote}“My biggest advocacy is ultrasounds. They're so portable, they're so effective, they're so affordable. That should be armed in every general practitioner's office and meet that standard of care for women where they're at,” said Cutter.{/blockquote}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"breast3.PNG\" data-caption=\"While%20many%20states%20require%20secondary%20screening%20coverage,%2016%20do%20not%20-%20leaving%20a%20patchwork%20of%20coverage%20for%20women%20across%20the%20country.%20Photo:%20SBG\" data-duration=\"\" data-externalid=\"98302a79-8bf5-44a5-9669-315eca03d1f1\" data-mediatype=\"image\" 648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/788/648/0x71/90/98302a79-8bf5-44a5-9669-315eca03d1f1-breast3.PNG%22,%22width%22:788,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:71,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22da75e92d-ccf1-4c96-bf50-76013c1f67b9%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-title=\"Women%20still%20face%20uphill%20battle%20for%20breast%20cancer%20tests,%20despite%20new%20density%20notifications\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media2/16x9/788/648/0x71/90/98302a79-8bf5-44a5-9669-315eca03d1f1-breast3.PNG%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3EWhile%20many%20states%20require%20secondary%20screening%20coverage,%2016%20do%20not%20-%20leaving%20a%20patchwork%20of%20coverage%20for%20women%20across%20the%20country.%20Photo:%20SBG%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}But in many states, those essential, additional screenings aren’t covered by insurance.{/p}{blockquote}“What we need is the pressure on the insurance companies,” said senior US Representative Rosa DeLauro. “ The insurance, has to have full coverage, no cost share to get these additional screenings, and that's what has to happen.”{/blockquote}{p}Congresswoman DeLauro, a cancer survivor herself, is pushing a bi-partisan effort for universal insurance coverage of supplemental screenings. Her Find It Early Act was introduced in the last session but did not come to a vote.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"breast2%20delauro.PNG\" data-caption=\"Congresswoman%20Rosa%20DeLauro%20has%20long%20championed%20womens%20health%20issues.%20Her%20bill%20would%20require%20insurance%20companies%20to%20cover%20secondary%20screenings%20for%20women%20with%20dense%20breasts.%20Photo:%20SBG%7Bp%7D%7Bbr%7D%7B/p%7D\" edium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1030/648/0x9/90/17d8bc15-4953-46be-ab80-cd573be3623b-breast2delauro.PNG%22,%22width%22:1030,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:9,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22c85347df-619a-4fd3-9770-270d230c495d%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}“In order to pass a piece of legislation, you have to have 218 votes,” said DeLauro. She says the public putting pressure on members, is what gets a bill over the finish line.{/p}{p}DeLauro says she will persist because with no federal legislation in place, 16 states - including California, Virginia and Florida have no laws to mandate coverage for additional screening, and many other states are inconsistent. You can see a full breakdown of the insurance laws nationwide from DenseBreast-Info {a href=\"https://densebreast-info.org/legislative-information/state-law-insurance-map/\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://densebreast-info.org/legislative-information/state-law-insurance-map/\"}here{/a}.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"stateswithnoloaw.PNG\" ium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/878/648/0x6/90/ce4a92b4-f827-4dbf-818f-19c63157735e-stateswithnoloaw.PNG%22,%22width%22:878,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:6,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22312c56ca-56d0-4cc5-ba12-655661bd7dfc%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{blockquote}“If we don't fill those gaps, women die,” said DeLauro. “It's very simple. It's very simple.”{/blockquote}{p}DeLauro will reintroduce the Find It Early Act in the coming weeks. She stressed that the best way for her bill to pass is if the public reaches out to their member of Congress and lets him or her know this is an issue that is important to them.{/p}{p}“I want to encourage women all over the country to be in touch with their member of Congress, to ask them to sign on to the Find It Early Act,” said DeLauro. “The real dynamic is the external pressure from outside of the institution, and that's women, their families, the organizations who are focused on preventing breast cancer to bring the pressure to bear on the institution, to move forward and to pass this legislation.”{/p}{p}{strong}To find out how to contact your member of Congress,{/strong} {a href=\"https://www.usa.gov/elected-officials\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://www.usa.gov/elected-officials\"}click here.{/a}{/p}{p}HEADLINE: Gorgeous weekend ahead{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 49 NORMAL LOW: 52{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 75 NORMAL HIGH: 73{/p}{p}Now we're talking!{/p}{p}A seasonably cool morning turned into a mild afternoon with most areas reaching the mid 70s under mostly sunny skies.{/p}{p}Expect fair skies overnight with lows in the mid to upper 50s.{/p}{p}A mix of sun and clouds tomorrow with highs in the mid 70s.{/p}{p}High pressure will be the dominant feature through the end of next week before a cold font arrives dropping temperatures down to near normal.{/p}{p}Temperatures will get close to 80 by the end of the weekend and close to 90 by next Tuesday and Wednesday.{/p}{p}This would be the first 90 of the year which normally occurs around April 15th.{/p}{p}No precipitation is expected through the end of the month.{/p}{p}Extreme to Exceptional drought conditions remain across MOST of southern Nevada including Clark County.{/p}{p}SNOWPACK - UPPER COLORADO: RIGHT NOW: 88% A YEAR AGO: 101%{/p}{p}Lake Mead is currently at 1067 feet compared to 1075 feet one year ago today.{/p}{p}Total valley rainfall in 2025: 0.59\" (-1.10\" below normal){/p}{p}Total valley rainfall through March 21st, 2024: 1.92\" (+0.23\" above normal){/p}{p}AIR QUALITY -
